education.institution: Macau University of Science and Technology
courses: Data Warehouse and Data Mining A+
Research Methods in Information Technology A+

publications.name: Automatic Portrait Image Pixelization
publications.objective: Maintaining sharp boundaries in low-resolution while using a limited color range to convey the image content.
highlights: Extracted portrait features using the Cascade Object Detection algorithm.
Abstractly represented images through non-uniform five-dimensional clustering, considering spatial and color aspects, based on pixel art characteristics. Algorithms used: SLIC Superpixels, FISODATA.
Enhanced image effects using algorithms such as Gaussian Bilateral Filtering, Sobel Edge Detection and Morphological Algorithms.
publications.summary: By combining the strengths of existing methods, a novel approach is proposed for automatic pixelated image generation. This method incorporates image downscaling techniques and color gradient extraction methods to enhance visual effects and meet the aesthetic requirements of pixel art.

publications.name: Improved Viola-Jones face detection algorithm under the HoloLens headset
publications.objective: Hololens Device-Based Facial Detection for Real-Time Applications. Compared to existing face detection interfaces, the accuracy has increased by 12%, and the detection speed has improved fourfold.
highlights: Boosted the detection speed of the classic Viola-Jones face detection algorithm using two-dimensional convolution separation.
Optimized detection speed in the application by leveraging image resampling techniques with Microsoft's mixed reality headset, HoloLens.
Leveraged SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping) technology for 3D positioning, enabling better human-computer interaction effects through gesture interaction.
publications.summary: Compared to existing face detection interfaces, the accuracy has increased by 12%, and the detection speed has improved fourfold.

work.name: Tencent Technology (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd
highlights: Led the development and implementation of DevOps algorithms for engineering efficiency, facilitating industrialized processing of user feedback to enhance efficiency and manpower allocation.
Research projects included intelligent classification of feedback text, log anomaly detection, high-frequency feedback alerting, invalid feedback filtering, and mutation testing algorithms.

Expertise in machine learning and deep learning algorithms in natural language processing and computer vision domains, with a focus on rapid paper reproduction and application integration using data cleaning, data augmentation, and few-shot learning techniques.

intern.name: Tencent Technology (Shenzhen) Co., Ltd
highlights: Led the development of feedback preprocessing services for the platform, encompassing text similarity and image similarity, completing background research, solution formulation, algorithm prototyping, technical documentation, and requirement reviews.
Managed data statistics services, filtering and analyzing invalid and known issues, conducting root cause analysis for resolved problems, and optimizing rejected issues.

projects.name: Intelligent Classification of Feedback Text
projects.summary: The project employs a cascaded approach, combining machine learning and deep learning models, to achieve multi-level classification of feedback text. It involves algorithm development and optimization from scratch to completion.

projects.name: Log Anomaly Detection
projects.summary: Combine online analysis capabilities and anomaly detection algorithms to provide a generalized solution for problem analysis, prediction, and recommendation. This improves problem localization efficiency for businesses.

projects.name: High-Frequency Feedback Alert System Reconstruction
projects.summary: Reconstruct and upgrade an outdated project to monitor newly emerging hotspots in user feedback in real-time by employing condition filtering, threshold judgment, fluctuation detection, and algorithm mining of high-frequency words.

projects.name: Feedback Information Preprocessing
projects.summary: Achieved a 65% reduction in repetitive issues, increased duplicate detection rate by 122%, and optimized the input-output ratio of feedback problems

projects.name: Data Statistics
projects.summary: Transitioned from 2 person-days of offline statistics to real-time statistics, improving accuracy and generating traceable source data.

patents.name: A feedback information classification method, apparatus, electronic device, and storage medium.
Training method, detection method, and apparatus for a log detection model.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
